intro: Asyneuma leianthum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Asyneuma leianthum is adapted to survive in harsh, sandy environments with minimal water availability.
